content:
IDatabaseOperations IDatabaseOperations Interface

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Azure.Management.Sql
Assembly:
Microsoft.Azure.Management.Sql.dll

Represents all the operations for operating on Azure SQL Databases. Contains operations to: Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete databases, and also includes the ability to get the event logs for a database.

Edit

In this Article

public interface IDatabaseOperationsPublic Interface IDatabaseOperations

Methods

BeginCreateOrUpdateAsync(String, String, String, DatabaseCreateOrUpdateParameters, CancellationToken) BeginCreateOrUpdateAsync(String, String, String, DatabaseCreateOrUpdateParameters, CancellationToken)

Edit

Begins creating a new Azure SQL Database or updating an existing Azure SQL Database. To determine the status of the operation call GetDatabaseOperationStatus.

Task<DatabaseCreateOrUpdateResponse> BeginCreateOrUpdateAsync(string resourceGroupName, string serverName, string databaseName, DatabaseCreateOrUpdateParameters parameters, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Function BeginCreateOrUpdateAsync(resourceGroupName As String, serverName As String, databaseName As String, parameters As DatabaseCreateOrUpdateParameters, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task(Of DatabaseCreateOrUpdateResponse)
Parameters
resourceGroupName
String String

The name of the Resource Group to which the Azure SQL Database Server belongs.

serverName
String String

The name of the Azure SQL Database Server on which the database is hosted.

databaseName
String String

The name of the Azure SQL Database to be operated on (Updated or created).

parameters
DatabaseCreateOrUpdateParameters DatabaseCreateOrUpdateParameters

The required parameters for creating or updating a database.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns
Task<DatabaseCreateOrUpdateResponse> Task(Of DatabaseCreateOrUpdateResponse)

Response for long running Azure Sql Database operations.

DeleteAsync(String, String, String, CancellationToken) DeleteAsync(String, String, String, CancellationToken)

Edit

Deletes the Azure SQL Database with the given name.

databaseName

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.

Edit
